TopicTitle: So we're still getting SteamDB updates.

Articles.Content: There are a few pressing issues with 0.24 (particularly with the 64-bit build), so that's not surprising.
What makes you think development comes to a halt after a release? Of course they're working on the next version. Not that surprising really.
Are they working on .24.1 or .25? After all, a few things for .25 have been started being worked on a few weeks ago according to the devnotes (IVAs, plane parts)

Are they working on .24.1 or .25? After all, a few things for .25 have been started being worked on a few weeks ago according to the devnotes (IVAs, plane parts)

PLANE PARTS AND IVAs!!!!

Are they working on .24.1 or .25? After all, a few things for .25 have been started being worked on a few weeks ago according to the devnotes (IVAs, plane parts)

It's definitely not 0.25. More likely a 0.24.1 to smooth out bugs.

It's definitely not 0.25. More likely a 0.24.1 to smooth out bugs.

Ah, ok, its nice to have a patch build instead of waiting for the next update. The last patch was .21.1 right? Wow, an entire year ago.

I hope those claw bugs finally get fixed, those things summon the Kraken far too much...
I always thought the Kraken was an intended feature and easter egg that actually lived on in the Jool part of the kerbal system. Do you mean to tell me its not?

It's not. The Kraken is, sadly, just a family of bugs within the games code that've been really hard to iron out for the devs!

But the Kraken on one of the moons of Jool (Uhm..Bop? I think?) Is intentional. It's also rather cute for a demonic, craft eating space monster.

It's definitely not 0.25. More likely a 0.24.1 to smooth out bugs.

Quoted for parading in joy!

It's definitely not 0.25. More likely a 0.24.1 to smooth out bugs.

Thanks for the Update on an updated for the update, Rows

What makes you think development comes to a halt after a release? Of course they're working on the next version. Not that surprising really.

They wouldn't be releasing it to experimentals or QA already if there's almost nothing actually finished yet.

It's definitely not 0.25. More likely a 0.24.1 to smooth out bugs.

So First and a Half Contract? :-)

Makes me happy to see this. The structure of the game is at a good place, but what's needed is cleaning and bug-squashing, especially if they're committed to making use of 64-bit. And it looks like they're not wasting any time.

Kudos to Squad.
I hope its 24.1 to hammer out some of the pressing issues on the x64 Windows client. I'm still running the Linux version and can't wait to do a full move to Windows for KSP

The last patch was .21.1 right? Wow, an entire year ago.

Wasn't .23.5 a patch as well? Well, technically it would be a feature-patch, but still.

Wasn't .23.5 a patch as well? Well, technically it would be a feature-patch, but still.

Not really. 0.23.5 was "this is kinda a new version, but we hadn't planned on it and integrated it into the versions plan (0.24 was planned for contracts), so let's name it 0.23.5". Patches fix bugs; 0.23.5 added features.

Not really. 0.23.5 was "this is kinda a new version, but we hadn't planned on it and integrated it into the versions plan (0.24 was planned for contracts), so let's name it 0.23.5". Patches fix bugs; 0.23.5 added features.

Ah, I see. Thanks for clearing up.
